isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: HOLSET SS 296 AND QE 296/338 - DISASSEMBLE - QE COMPRESSOR

note.para: Clean and blow dry the top section of the air compressor. Take special care to clean and blow out the areas around the joints connecting the components to be separated.
If the cylinder head is removed while the air compressor is on the engine, drain the engine coolant. Refer to GROUP 12 - COOLING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual and/or the Operator's Manual.
Since the valve body, head and unloader body can be mounted in different positions, marking of these parts is recommended to make sure they are reassembled in the same position as removed.

warning.para: The unloader valve body is installed with spring tension. It must be removed carefully to avoid personal injury. Wear safety glasses.

step1.para: Hold down on the unloader valve body and remove the two inlet connection body bolts and flat washers, then remove the two unloader valve body bolts and flat washers ( Figure 36). Save these bolts and washers for reuse at re-assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 36. Remove Two Bolts and Washers

step1.para: Remove the unloader body and spring ( Figure 37).

figure.caption: Figure 37. Remove Unloader Body and Spring

step1.para: Remove the unloader cap and unloader vee seal ( Figure 38). Use a pick, if necessary, to remove the vee seal. Do not damage the groove.

figure.caption: Figure 38. Remove Unloader Cap and Unloader Vee Seal

step1.para: Remove the unloader body O-ring ( Figure 39). Use a pick, if necessary; avoid damage to the groove.
Remove the inlet connection body and air intake gasket ( Figure 40).
Loosen, but do not remove, the center head bolt. Mark the head for reassembly in the same position as removed ( Figure 41).
Loosen and remove the four corner head bolts and washers. Save the bolts and washers for reuse ( Figure 42).

figure.caption: Figure 42. Remove Four Corner Bolts and Washers

step1.para: Remove the head cover, head and valve body assembly ( Figure 43). Place it on a clean work surface with the intake valve facing upward.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Remove Head and Valve Body Assembly

caution.para: If continuing with disassembly of the head cover, head, and valve body, be sure the work surface is clean. Grit pushed into the valve sealing surfaces by setting components on a dirty surface will cause a malfunction after re-assembly.

step1.para: Some units may have a press-fit or staked-in-place intake valve retainer. If present, use a screwdriver to carefully remove it; try to prevent part damage ( Figure 44).

note.para: International recommends that compressors be serviced with a QE Valve Body Service Kit ( Figure 13).

step1.para: Turn the head assembly over and set it on a clean surface. Remove the center bolt and washer ( Figure 45). Save this bolt and washer for reuse. Note that this bolt is shorter than the four corner bolts.

figure.caption: Figure 45. Remove Center Bolt and Washer

step1.para: Remove the cover, cover gasket, head and head gasket ( Figure 46).
Remove the two wave springs, exhaust valve retainer and exhaust valve. These wave washers must be replaced ( Figure 47).

note.para: International recommends that compressors be serviced with a QE Valve Body Service kit ( Figure 13).
